page.title: 01Woolton,Garston and Halewood
page.content: Woolton,Garston & Allerton have their roots in the past. Halewood, built in the 60s to house Liverpool's overspill, is more modern. Woolton appears in the original Domesday Book and has buildings that are hundreds of years old. Woolton Hall was a Georgian Manor House. Stone from Woolton Quarry was used to build the Anglican Cathedral in Liverpool. Garston with its market, railways and 108 year old Gothic style church, is a mixture of old and new. Allerton Hall built in the 18th Century forms the centrepiece of Clarkes Gardens; with the Merseyside Police College, it dominates this area. Organised leisure plays a key part in children's lives. Gymnastics, Morris Dancing, Computing, Keep fit, Ballet and swimming find their place alongside guides, scouts, brownies and cubs. P.SWEENEY.
